title: Healthy Road Trip Snacks
description: Healthy Road Trip Snacks? Do they exist? THEY DO!! Weâ€™ve had to be on the road a lot for baseball, and Iâ€™ve become an experienced snack packer for our road trips. My guys are always down to stop at fast food restaurants and gas stations for sustenance. Me? Not so much. Thatâ€™s where meal prep comes in! Before you pack for a road trip, here are some questions to ask! How long will you be on the road? Will you have a cooler with you so you can store things? Whatâ€™s the easiest thing to eat while on the road that wonâ€™t make a mess? Can you have the snacks accessible to you so you donâ€™t have to stop? Here are some sample snack situations. (This is the stainless steel bento box I love!) This combo includes: strawberries, gf crackers, salami + cheese, and trail mix Pack a deli container with Greek yogurt, bananas & granola. Bring an ice pack or a portable cooler if you can! This combo includes: apples with lime (a flavorful way to prevent browning), trail mix, carrots & a bagel with cream cheese. I included a napkin for good measure! Pack a pasta salad! I recommend Cold Soba Noodle Salad or my Mediterranean Pasta Salad for a road trip. Pack a salad TO GO! This is a meal prep container, which makes it easier to eat if youâ€™re in the car. This is my Chopped Italian Salad, by the way. Another good salad that travels well and can be eaten out of a deli container is my Thai Broccoli Salad! This combo includes sliced cheese, figs, grapes, stuffed dates, and trail mix. Pack an insulated food container with a soup! I think this one has Chicken Soup in it. This combo includes: crackers, trail mix, a Larabar, ranch dip, celery, cheese, and pickles! All the elements I love- sweet, savory, crunchy, and tangy!
excerpt: Fuel your next adventure with these Healthy Road Trip Snacks! Easy, packable, and delicious ideas from Shutterbean to keep you satisfied on the go.

html:
Healthy Road Trip Snacks?Â  Do they exist?Â  THEY DO!!Â 

Weâ€™ve had to be on the road a lot for baseball, and Iâ€™ve become an experienced snack packer for our road trips. My guys are always down to stop at fast food restaurants and gas stations for sustenance. Me? Not so much. Thatâ€™s where meal prep comes in!

Before you pack for a road trip, here are some questions to ask!Â 

  • How long will you be on the road?
  • Will you have a cooler with you so you can store things?
  • Whatâ€™s the easiest thing to eat while on the road that wonâ€™t make a mess?
  • Can you have the snacks accessible to you so you donâ€™t have to stop?

Here are some sample snack situations.Â 

(This is the stainless steel bento box I love!)Â 

Â 

This combo includes: strawberries, gf crackers, salami + cheese, and trail mix

Pack a deli container with Greek yogurt, bananas & granola. Bring an ice pack or a portable cooler if you can!Â 

This combo includes: apples with lime (a flavorful way to prevent browning), trail mix, carrots & a bagel with cream cheese.Â 

I included a napkin for good measure!Â 

Pack a pasta salad!Â  I recommend Cold Soba Noodle Salad or my Mediterranean Pasta Salad for a road trip.Â 

Pack a salad TO GO! This is a meal prep container, which makes it easier to eat if youâ€™re in the car.

This is my Chopped Italian Salad, by the way.Â 

Another good salad that travels well and can be eaten out of a deli container is my Thai Broccoli Salad!Â 

This combo includes sliced cheese, figs, grapes, stuffed dates, and trail mix.Â 

Pack an insulated food container with a soup! I think this one has Chicken Soup in it.Â 

This combo includes: crackers, trail mix, a Larabar, ranch dip, celery, cheese, and pickles!Â 

All the elements I love- sweet, savory, crunchy, and tangy!

Hereâ€™s a big jar filled with apple and persimmon slices. I had a fork in the glove compartment ðŸ˜‰

Donâ€™t forget to pack some fresh fruit!Â
